p: Phylogeographic analysis of Core-E1 revealed that subtype 1a infection in Cyprus originated from Switzerland and Thailand (Supplementary Fig. S1a) while analysis of NS5B revealed infections originating from Switzerland and Thailand, but also Great Britain, Italy, Australia and New Zealand (Fig. 1; Supplementary Fig. S2a). Subsequent statistical phylogeographic analysis revealed the locations of significant sources of HCV viral mobility to Cyprus. The viral mobility events estimated between the different locations are described in Supplementary Tables S1a and S2a. Interestingly, for both genomic regions, the United States of America (USA) was not revealed as a significant source for the 1a subtype in Cyprus (Fig. 1). The estimated viral migrations shown in Supplementary Tables S1a and S2a correspond to population size equal to those used as the source (exporting) and sink populations in this analysis.
